title: "Effective Techniques for Improving Attention and Focus"
first_phrase: In this final part, we delve into the concept of attention and how to increase it effectively. Drawing inspiration from Jules Payot's recommendations, we learn that attention is like radium; in small quantities, it can have a prodigious effect. To increase voluntary attention, one must learn to breathe slowly and deeply as taught in Buddhist practices. Additionally, immobility and deep breathing help with distraction. Finally, we explore Th. Ribot's theories on attention: the mechanism of attention is essentially motor, and the ability to govern one's muscles correlates with one's ability to pay attention.

last_phrase: In conclusion, if you want to improve your attention and focus, you can practice the art of complete relaxation by following the instructions in the book "Hypnotize Yourself" and setting a clear goal for yourself. Remember that the mechanism of attention is essentially motor, so it's crucial to be able to control your muscles. By applying these techniques, you can improve your mental and physical performances.
